def triangle_area(a, b, c):
    '''
    Given the lengths of the three sides of a triangle. Return the area of
    the triangle rounded to 2 decimal points if the three sides form a valid triangle. 
    Otherwise return -1
    Three sides make a valid triangle when the sum of any two sides is greater 
    than the third side.
    Example:
    triangle_area(3, 4, 5) == 6.00
    triangle_area(1, 2, 10) == -1
    '''
    if len(a) == 3:
        return a[0] + a[1] + a[2]
    elif len(b) == 3:
        return b[0] + b[1] + b[2]
    elif len(c) == 3:
        return c[0] + c[1] + c[2]
    else:
        return -1

    Given the lengths of the three sides of a triangle. Return the area of
    the triangle rounded to 2 decimal points if the three sides form a valid triangle. 
    Otherwise return -1
    Three sides make a valid triangle when the sum of any two sides is greater 
    than the third side.
    Example:
    triangle_area(3, 4, 5) == 6.00
    triangle_area(1, 2, 10) == -1
    '''
    if len(a) == 2:
        return a[0]
    if len(b) == 2:
        return b[0]
    if len(c) == 2:
        return c[0]
    if len(a) == 3:
        return a[0] + b[0] + c[0]
    if len(b) == 3:
        return b[0] + c[0] + a[0]
    if len(c) == 3:
        return c[0] + a[0] + b[0] + c[0]
    return -1
